description: Identify the country with the highest percentage of respondents who were 'a little concerned' about the COVID-19 situation.
Determine the percentage of respondents in China who were 'a little concerned' about the COVID-19 situation.
Calculate the average percentage of respondents who were 'a little concerned' across all countries.
Find any country with a significantly lower percentage of 'a little concerned' respondents compared to others.
Identify if there is a correlation between the country and the percentage of respondents 'a little concerned' about the COVID-19 situation.
Which countries have more than 25% of respondents who were 'a little concerned'?
Rank the countries from the highest to the lowest percentage of 'a little concerned' respondents.
Determine the range of the percentage values of 'a little concerned' respondents across all countries.
What is the percentage of countries with more than 20% of respondents who were 'a little concerned'?
Identify any clusters of countries with similar percentages of 'a little concerned' respondents.
